programme.title: All in the Family
programme.desc: Barney Hefner is suicidal when Blanche finally deserts him, until Archie fixes him up with an overweight but wealthy widow.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray's guilt manifests itself in an anxiety attack on the golf course.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Raymond is shocked to learn that his parents were once separated.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: Rob recalls directing the PTA show with Laura in the starring role.

programme.title: The Dick Van Dyke Show
programme.desc: A cat burglar is on the prowl, and Rob and Laura think they're the target.

programme.title: The Honeymooners
programme.desc: Ralph and Ed play pool with Ralph's boss and Ed gets a job at the bus company.

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: When a newlywed couple visit the groom's childhood home, the ties of the past prove too strong to resist.

programme.title: The Alfred Hitchcock Hour
programme.sub-title: A Piece Of The Action (s1, ep)
programme.desc: Expert gambler Duke Marsden finds his very existence at risk when he wins $30,000 from an inhuman ex-hood.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible
programme.desc: In trying to expose organized crime connections within the gambling industry, the IMF frame a casino operator so that the mob's rivalries and lethal management methods will do the talking.

programme.title: The Fugitive
programme.desc: After learning of the death of his father, Kimble contacts Donna and her husband Len Taft and wants to meet with them. Donna and Len drive to Fort Wayne, Indiana and check into a hotel under assumed names. But their rendezvous is threatened by Mike Ballin

programme.title: Harry O
programme.desc: "Harry Orwell is hard pressed to protect a former jazz great from a knife-wielding killer."

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: A pot-detecting pooch joins the police to stop marijuana smuggling.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Friday's problem: is his temporary partner an aide—or an adversary?

programme.title: Adam-12
programme.desc: Malloy and Reed become the repeated targets of an unidentified sniper who has them called to fake disturbances and follows them to some of their real calls, which include a special deliver, a suicide threat at a gas station and a reported prowler.

programme.title: Adam-12
programme.desc: Eight years after an act of heroism put him out of commission, an officer returns to active duty, only to find that the changes made to the job that limit an officer's power and increase suspects' rights are too much to handle.

programme.title: Leave It to Beaver
programme.desc: Beaver has been assigned to write a book report on 'The Three Musketeers.' However he's waited right down to the wire to get reading and quickly realizes that he'll never get finished. So, he decides to watch the movie that's going to be on TV and write his book report based on the movie.

programme.title: Leave It to Beaver
programme.desc: Ward is given two tickets to a baseball game and is faced with an impossible decision. Should he take Wally or Beaver? Beaver lets him off the hook when he announces he has plans with Gilbert. However, when they fall through, Beaver changes his mind about the game and becomes convinced because he's the youngest he gets the short stick.

programme.title: Perry Mason
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Lonely Eloper
programme.desc: Merle Telford is a naive and maladjusted young woman who is about to turn 21 and receive a substantial inheritance. She plans to run away from her guardians and elope with Danny Pierce as soon as she receives her money.

programme.title: Matlock
programme.desc: When a wife is accused of poisoning her ex-husband during the taping of a television cooking show, Matlock is hired to uncover the truth in this seemingly open-and-shut case.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-O
programme.sub-title: Three Dead Cows At Makapuu: Part 1
programme.desc: A biological scientist views his work as evil.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Strange things are occurring at the Walton home. The family uses a Ouija board to ask questions about the happenings

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A gang of thieves commandeers the Dodge City blacksmith shop to divide a gigantic bar of gold.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Susan Blanchard is injured in a wagon crash. Though there is nothing physically wrong with her, Susan is psychosomatically incapable of leaving her bed. Enter faith healer Garth, who promises to make Susan walk again.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas tries to find out why Mark has taken a job as a stableboy.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark and Milly are held prisoner in her general store when two gunmen attempt a daring robbery.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: On one final push to the west, a showman runs into some old friends. They were part of a massacre that almost cost them their lives, and cost one man his sanity.

programme.title: Emergency!
programme.desc: Conducting a fire inspection, Roy and John rescue a diver in a fish tank. A birthday boy eats raw dough and gets a stomachache. An experiment in firefighter nutrition becomes an obsession for Chet. A woman goes into labor while her mother experiences chest pains. Capt. Stanley is severely injured when he gets an electric shock from a fallen power line.

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: The 4077th is confronted by two crises: Colonel Potter's mare, Sophie, mysteriously disappears from her corral, and Hawkeye and B.J. find themselves with a young Korean boy on their hands, who is trying to avoid conscription into the Army.

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: A lecture on the latest techniques by a young surgeon from Tokyo, and a later demonstration of his surgical skill, turns Winchester into a drunk and Potter into an invalid, whilst bringing home to Hawkeye and B.J. that they are out of touch with new medical practices.

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.sub-title: Hot Lips Is Back In Town
programme.desc: Radar, who is smitten with the cute new nurse, Linda Nugent, relies on Hawkeye's expertise on how to cope with the situation. Hot Lips, meanwhile, celebrates her just-granted divorce by taking a step that arouses Colonel Potter's ire.

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: The 4077th evacuation to a nearby cave to avoid US artillery fire on a Chinese target poses problems for Hawkeye, who has a claustrophobia problem of which Colonel Potter is not aware.

programme.title: The Andy Griffith Show
programme.desc: The mayor calls in an investigator from the state capital to help solve a string of cow thefts.

programme.title: The Andy Griffith Show
programme.desc: Andy shows up for a date with Peggy McMillan only to learn her old friend, Don, has arrived unexpectedly, leading to a string of misunderstandings and Barney's attempts at help.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra asks Ray to start working from home.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra decides to try her hand at writing a children's book.

programme.title: Hogan's Heroes
programme.desc: Hogan gets a stray chimpanzee to deliver radio parts to the underground.

programme.title: Hogan's Heroes
programme.desc: After Hogan mines a bridge, he learns that a truck of Allied prisoners would be the first to cross it and a new plan is born which includes a flaming arrow from Sioux Indian Carter, aka Little Deer Who Goes Swift And Sure Through Forest.

programme.title: Carol Burnett and Friends
programme.desc: In The Bug, Carol thinks there's a bug in her hotel bed. Then, in The Family, Eunice celebrates Mama's birthday.

programme.title: Perry Mason
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Stuttering Bishop
programme.desc: Bishop Arthur Mallory is met in his hotel room by Wallace Lang, an associate of a wealthy man named Charles Burroughs. He is warned through physical violence to stop looking for Burroughs' granddaughter.

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: A widower buys a robotic grandmother for his three children.

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Presents
programme.desc: Revenge fuels a husband looking for the man who raped his wife

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Presents
programme.desc: A pianist returns to his home town, hoping to mend a broken relationship with his father, and instead finds mystery and foreboding in everything he encounters.

programme.title: Mannix
programme.desc: A valuable racehorse has disappeared on the way to Florida. Mannix is hired to retrieve the noble animal learn why it was abducted.

programme.title: Cannon
programme.desc: Cannon stirs up a hornet's nest worth of trouble after re-opening the case of an old shooting.

programme.title: Barnaby Jones
programme.desc: A man is tricked into thinking he committed a murder, but the real killer is his own friend who smuggles diamonds.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: A 15-year-old car thief is given a tour of the jail in an attempt to show him the consequences for choosing crime.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Friday and Gannon investigate the delay of death notifications in the state employment department.

programme.title: Adam-12
programme.desc: Malloy and Reed actively search for a serial rapist/murderer who hasn't left behind any solid clues, which causes Malloy to vent about what he perceives to be over-reliance on computers at the expense of old-fashioned police logic. In the meantime, they deal with a kid who crashes his friend's dirt bike, engage in a futile high-speed pursuit of a porsche and search for an armed suspect of a liquor store.

programme.title: Adam-12
programme.desc: Malloy and Reed deal with a surly victim of a purse snatching and search for her assailant, who is driving a vehicle that should be easy to spot. In the meantime, they surveil a disabled vehicle with a suspicious driver, respond to a loud music call at a residence that's been transformed into a hippie party house by its recently widowed owner, and break up a fist fight at a lunch stand.

programme.title: Leave It to Beaver
programme.desc: Eddie is happy to break the news that he plans to spend his summer on a fishing boat in Alaska and this prompts Wally and Lumpy to think about signing up to do the same thing. However, they all get a dose of reality when they discover just what kind of conditions they would be living in.

programme.title: Leave It to Beaver
programme.desc: A school dance has Beaver with a major dilemma. He has two girls who ask him to go with them. However, he has a little problem, he accepted the first invitation but now wants out of it when he's asked by the second girl. This leads him to take some of Eddie's poor advice.

programme.title: Perry Mason
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Bogus Books
programme.desc: Mason investigates the murder of an antiquarian bookseller with an interest in forgery. It seems as though someone turned on the gas line to his office while he was taking his afternoon nap.

programme.title: Matlock
programme.desc: After a scurrilous book leads to murder, Matlock finds himself defending the suspected killer, soon realizing that the case is not at all what it seems.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-O
programme.sub-title: Three Dead Cows At Makapuu: Part 2
programme.desc: The deadly toxin is lost and McGarrett has to find the vial before it disintegrates and poisons the whole island.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John Boy graduates from school. Needs a suit. Ends up with grandpa's suit

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Six years after her husband's hanging, Ma Stone plots her revenge against Matt Dillon by first kidnapping Kitty to use as a lure and then jailing Matt with the intention to hang him.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Joe and Adam's differences in politics lead to unrest in the house. When Joe is picked to go to a convention on the statehood of Nevada, will his relationship with a admitted Confederate's daughter weigh his decision?

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Two prison wagon drivers stop at the McCain ranch looking for whiskey. Lucas turns them down because they are escorting Rudy Croft, a murderer who is to be hanged in Yuma.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark goes to work for Will Temple, a badly scarred and very mysterious rancher.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: Trail-hardened Cassie Tanner joins the train, setting her eye on Major Adams. When the train desperately needs horses, she may be the only one able to make the dangerous journey to buy them.

programme.title: Emergency!
programme.desc: John gets everyone but Roy excited about buying into a nearby hot dog stand. By the time Roy gets interested, the stand burns down. A man is injured in an accident with a power lawn mower.

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: The sinister Colonel Flagg pops up at the 4077th again, playing his usual spy games, convinced that Hawkeye is a communist sympathizer after he saves the life of a North Korean soldier. Also, an American soldier is less than impressed.

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: On a sub-note, Klinger plays the part of a voodoo practitioner to try and get out of the Army.

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: A typical day in the life of Rosie's bar, complete with AWOL problem drinkers, a bound and gagged Winchester and a gambling scheme.

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: The impossible happens for the snobbish Charles when he shares an emotional experience with Klinger, who discovers a US nurse, Debbie, finds him and his bizarre attire attractive, while Charles succumbs to the exotic charms of a Korean girl, called Sooni, who he meets at Rosie's Bar.

programme.title: The Andy Griffith Show
programme.desc: Barney's ability to be a lawman is put to the test with some peddlers and he fails. His confidence is shattered until Andy steps in behind the scenes and warns the peddlers of "Fife the Fierce."

programme.title: The Andy Griffith Show
programme.desc: Mayor Stoner declares the town's marching band a disgrace and refuses to allocate money for its annual trip to the state competition. Andy takes matters into his own hands, with help from Bobby Fleet and his Band with a Beat.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray is feeling guilty about only getting his dad a card for his 65th birthday.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray reluctantly takes Deborah to his 20th high school reunion.

programme.title: Hogan's Heroes
programme.sub-title: Clearance Sale At The Black Market
programme.desc: After seeing something he shouldn't have, Schultz is ordered to the Russian front.

programme.title: Hogan's Heroes
programme.desc: Hogan leads Klink to believe a rabbit trap is a secret electronic device in order for Klink to bring an electronics expert, who wants to defect, to camp.

programme.title: Carol Burnett and Friends
programme.desc: In Stella Toddler, Carol plays an accident-prone woman whose recover is inhibited by her hospital roommate. Then, in The Man Without a Green Thumb, Tim fights with an aggressive plant. Finally, in The Oldest Man, Vicki is tortured by the Oldest Man, who's so old he only hurts himself.

programme.title: Perry Mason
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Lost Last Act
programme.desc: Playwright Ernest Royce is found shot to death in the same manner as a character in one of his un-produced plays. The play deals with characters very close to real people and the real-life murder of a New York underworld figure.

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: An angel trying to earn his wings comes to the aide of a down-on-her-luck woman who has just been fired.

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Presents
programme.desc: Maggie, a restaurant owner, tries to prevent a duel between two customers.

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Presents
programme.desc: A detective suspects murder when a man tries to have his missing wife declared dead.

programme.title: Mannix
programme.desc: Joe Mannix must trace the missing son of a policeman. The mother fears that he might be involved in a robbery.

programme.title: Cannon
programme.desc: "Tim Jardine was persuaded by his friends Amy and Claude to blackmail his father for 50,000 dollars. Nevertheless, Jardine's father is facing bankruptcy and Claude loses his patience and becomes a criminal."

programme.title: Barnaby Jones
programme.desc: Barnaby probes the death of a heavily-insured man that is believed to be an accident.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: The battered-child syndrome: Friday and Gannon investigate a youngster with severe back lacerations.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: A costumed thief calling himself "The Crimson Crusader" has been stealing comic books, movie posters and publicity photos of various superheroes.

programme.title: Adam-12
programme.desc: Malloy and reed report to a disturbance at a night club caused by a young folk singer whose career has been derailed by drug addiction and contends that she is being threatened with death by the manager who is a member of a large drug ring. Reed agrees to

programme.title: Adam-12
programme.desc: "Bandits using tear gas and a unique escape route rob an armored truck at a savings and loan."

programme.title: Leave It to Beaver
programme.desc: It's come down to the final week before junior high school graduation and Beaver is having a ball and even skips a class with Gilbert. However, Beaver becomes convinced he won't graduate after Gilbert and him take a peek at the diplomas on Mrs. Rayburn's desk and find Beaver's diploma to be missing.

programme.title: Leave It to Beaver
programme.desc: Wally and Eddie fall prey to Lumpy's practical joking after he plants cherry bombs under the hoods of Eddie's car and Wally's car. Both Eddie and Wally want to get him back but their plan goes awry when they destroy Lumpy's car after chaining it to a tree. All fingers point to Wally after Fred finds that the chain has Ward's name printed on it.

programme.title: Perry Mason
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Capricious Corpse
programme.desc: When a major financial supporter of an orphanage lapses into a coma and later dies, his nephew pursues plans to shut down the institution.

programme.title: Matlock
programme.desc: Matlock defends a Beverly Hills cookie entrepreneur charged with murdering his girlfriend. While the case against the man looks bleak, Matlock eventually uncovers a secret love triangle.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-O
programme.desc: A con artist blackmails a politician into taking her to an event where she can steal the priceless Queen of Polynesia emerald and swap it for a fake.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Olivia buys books from a peddler who does not turn in the order

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Marshal Dillon is helped by an apparently friendly young runaway who later faces him as a deadly adversary.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Joe befriends a young man, Billy Horne, a white man captured and raised by the Shoshones. Meanwhile, Milton Tanner goes after a third of the Ponderosa. Seeing that his new friends are in trouble, Billy takes matters into his own hands.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Corey Hazlett insists he's innocent of murder, despite Lucas's eyewitness testimony.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas tries to dissuade a latter-day knight from rushing into battle.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: Tensions are running high in the train between Northerners and Southerners traveling west. As trouble escalates one passenger with a noticeable limp, John Wilbot, is accused of being John Wilkes Booth, who many believe to still be alive.

programme.title: Emergency!
programme.desc: John becomes the victim of a hit and run. While hospitalized, he flirts with his physical therapist and deals with a nurse who seems to have it in for him. The rest of the station must adjust to a difficult replacement.

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: Talk of a post-war reunion gives B.J. an idea—planning a present-day stateside gathering of 4077th families. He continues to obsess with the idea even under the duress of bug-out instigated by a Chinese breakthrough. Also, Klinger fears that the party will blow his cover, as his mother doesn't know he's stationed in Korea.

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: A clumsy foot soldier, "Look Out Below" Conway, finds the quickest way to the crew's heart, boosting morale at the 4077th by cooking gourmet delights. Only Colonel Potter, burdened with a personal crisis, is immune from the high spirits enveloping the hospital.

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: A Congressional aide, Williamson, visits the 4077th on a supposedly routine fact-finding tour, but it's discovered that his motives are far deeper—too uncover Margaret as a communist sympathizer. His case is full of innuendo, so the gang set out to help Margaret.

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: The arrival of a wounded Korean woman sparks a conflict at the 4077th: Hawkeye wants to heal her, but a steely ROK officer, Lt. Park, is more anxious to "question" her about alleged guerilla activities.

programme.title: The Andy Griffith Show
programme.desc: Madeline Grayson, a rich widow that Floyd has been "pen-palling" with, announces in her next letter that she wants to meet him face-to-face. Of course, the whole time Floyd has been pretending in his letters to be a wealthy entrepreneur.

programme.title: The Andy Griffith Show
programme.desc: Opie is afraid that Andy's new girlfriend, Peggy, will take his place in his father's heart, and sets out to sabotage their relationship.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra decides to tell Ray's mom she can't stand her being so critical.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: All Ray wants for Christmas is a little loving from his wife.

programme.title: Hogan's Heroes
programme.desc: Crittendon interferes as Hogan tries to help a defecting scientist, whom they were ordered to kill.

programme.title: Hogan's Heroes
programme.sub-title: Hogan's Trucking Service... We Deliver The Factory To You
programme.desc: Colonel Crittendon shows up again and messes up Hogan's plans to destroy a ball bearing plant.

programme.title: Carol Burnett and Friends
programme.desc: In Stella Toddler and the Oldest Man, Carol plays an accident-prone woman who buys shoes from the Oldest Man. Then, in Flora, the gang parodies classic film-noir "Laura", with Carol as Gene Tierney and Steve as Dana Andrews.

programme.title: Perry Mason
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Bedeviled Doctor
programme.desc: Dr. David Craig discovers that tapes of conversations with his psychiatric patients are missing and being used for blackmail purposes. When the suspected thief and blackmailer, Mark Douglas, turns up murdered, Craig is charged with the crime.

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: An elderly private school teacher wonders if his life has meant anything as he contemplates suicide on Christmas Eve.

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Presents
programme.desc: A woman and her mother check into a Paris hotel. The woman goes out and when she returns her mother is gone, nobody remembers her mother and the room now looks totally different.

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Presents
programme.desc: Dan, an underworld kingpin, hatches a plan to punish a singer who killed his brother.

programme.title: Mannix
programme.desc: Mannix's client hires him to find the man who saved his son's life. The search takes him to an island near South America, and then the next link in the chain turns up dead.

programme.title: Cannon
programme.desc: "Cannon helps fake the murder of a mobster in order to allow the man to testify against his boss."

programme.title: Barnaby Jones
programme.desc: A pair of amateur singers commit larceny and murder in an attempt to finance a record.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Posing as orange growers, Friday and Gannon attempt to bust a gambling operation.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Gary Crosby plays a hippie whose wife has been persuaded—by other hippies—to pass bad checks.

programme.title: Adam-12
programme.desc: Malloy is told that the best player on the recreational league basketball team he coaches has begun using narcotics again, which he flatly denies despite evidence to the contrary. He and Reed also search for a hit-and-run driver who struck a child, and pull over a driver with a seemingly disrespectful and wanted passenger.

programme.title: Adam-12
programme.desc: Malloy and Reed investigate the ransacking of a college football locker room and uncover a controversial performance enhancing drug program. They also investigate suspicious parents who backtrack after their maid reports their baby as missing, apprehend a reported prowler who is then suspiciously let into the home by the female accuser and engage in a bullet-riddled high speed chase through a residential area.

programme.title: Toon In With Me
programme.desc: "Bill looks backward at the pop culture of 1992... and dresses backwards, too."

programme.title: Leave It to Beaver
programme.desc: After graduation, an all-night party is set to begin, which has June and Ward very wary. They aren't sure if they should allow Wally to attend. Meanwhile, Wally's date for the party has the same problem. This leads her to invite Wally to meet her folks and put their worries to rest.

programme.title: Leave It to Beaver
programme.desc: Beaver has the chance to travel around the country for six weeks during the summer and he's all excited about it. However, he quickly realizes when he's gone Gilbert will go after the girl Beaver has a crush on, Mary Margaret. But he quickly realizes, there's more to life than Mary Margaret.

programme.title: Perry Mason
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Playboy Pugilist
programme.desc: Boxing trainer Jimmy West thinks he's finally found a championship contender in Davey Carroll. Unfortunately, Davey's tangled love life leads to Jimmy being charged with murder.

programme.title: Matlock
programme.desc: A private nurse accused of murdering her patient barters her engagement ring in exchange for Matlock's renowned defense services.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-O
programme.desc: The daughter of a top neurosurgeon is kidnapped.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John Boy is in need of a car, now that he is in college.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A respectable rancher and his son hang an innocent man and allow a bewhiskered bounty hunter to go on trial for the murder.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Wallowing in self-pity after having gone blind, Matthew Raine begins coming out of his self-imposed exile after befriending Ben's housekeeper, Ann Loring. However, there is someone who doesn't want Matthew to extricate himself from his miserable state.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Able Lincoln's claim that he's the Great Emancipator himself amuses everyone except Matt Yorty.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Stubborn Grandpa Fogarty is Lucas's main roadblock as he tries to get young Woody Fogarty to attend school.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: Low on water, Flint scouts for more. When three water holes are dry or poisoned, Fort Paiute seems their only hope but he has to make it back to the wagon train on foot and the only other man who knows the way is believed to be a deserter.

programme.title: Emergency!
programme.desc: Roy and John are assigned to work the big football game at the Coliseum. A woman accidentally pulls her husband off the roof into a tree. At the game, the paramedics treat a choking victim, a man with breathing difficulties, an injured photographer and a TV announcer with heart trouble.

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: On leave in Tokyo, Radar is desperately needed back at the crisis-stricken 4077th, but his return is delayed by outside events. While casualties continue to pour in from the front, the 4077th's generator conks out, and the backup has been stolen.

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: As company clerk Radar O'Reilly reluctantly prepares to depart the 4077th, the unit is still without electricity due to a broken generator, and the operating room continues to fill up with war wounded as night falls.

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: Klinger and B.J. both have Radar-related woes, causing them to go on a drinking binge. A drunken B.J. becomes violent with Hawkeye.

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: A beautiful and ambitious young nurse, Harris, who plans to become a doctor when she leaves the Army, finds herself in a misunderstanding with Father Mulcahy. Meanwhile, the camp's water supply is depleted, and the rest of the 4077th is more concerned about where their next shower will come from.

programme.title: The Andy Griffith Show
programme.desc: Barney and Floyd run out of gas while coming home from a fishing trip. While looking for a telephone they are captured by three female escaped convicts.

programme.title: The Andy Griffith Show
programme.desc: Aunt Bea longs for a special present: a blue bed jacket.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray joins a Civil War re-enactment.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray's thrilled to finally meet a relative whom the whole family likes.

programme.title: Hogan's Heroes
programme.desc: The Gestapo gets three beautiful girls to pry secrets out of the guys.

programme.title: Hogan's Heroes
programme.sub-title: Man's Best Friend Is Not His Dog
programme.desc: A dog buries a bone containing film from Carter's camera that has images of a new German tank.

programme.title: Carol Burnett and Friends
programme.sub-title: Noisy Speech, The / Tv Commercials / Miss Nobody
programme.desc: In The Noisy Speech, Harvey tries to deliver a speech but his noisy friends interrupt him. Then, in TV Commercials, Carol and the gang parody TV products, including Jay Detergent, Buffercin, One-A-Way Vitamin, Dear's Sigh-Hard Battery, Mellow Pages, American Depressed Credit Card, Braces, Dear's Sigh Hard, and A Salty Fish. Finally, in Miss Nobody, Carol can't get anyone's attention, even after she causes a mess.

programme.title: Perry Mason
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Howling Dog
programme.desc: Evelyn Forbes escapes from a mental institution only to be charged with murder. The key to the case is a dog that continues to howl no matter what.

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: An alcoholic bookie regrets that he wasn't a better father to his son, Pip, critically wounded in South Vietnam.

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Presents
programme.desc: After a terrible accident leaves a man completely paralyzed, people who encounter him think he is dead, though he is very much alive.

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Presents
programme.desc: A real estate agent becomes obsessed with the idea that his new cook is a serial killer.

programme.title: Mannix
programme.desc: Still searching for the man who saved his client's son's life, Mannix stumbles into the ugly side of politics: an assassination plot.

programme.title: Cannon
programme.desc: "Cannon travels to a small town in Texas to investigate a young girl's suspicious death."

programme.title: Barnaby Jones
programme.desc: As a thief awaits trial, his accomplice puts out a contract on the only witness to the crime.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: A girl's life hangs in the balance as the detectives search for the dog that bit her.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: An infant girl is found in a garbage can; Joe and Bill use the child's blanket to track down the mother.

programme.title: Adam-12
programme.desc: An undercover cop is left in a coma after being shot while investigating a potential attack by a youth gang on an elders' association in chinatown, but his girlfriend refuses to disclose time critical information to malloy and reed on orders from her powe

programme.title: Adam-12
programme.desc: On temporary assignment at LAX, Reed and Malloy have to save a stewardess who is taken hostage inside a lounge by a man desperately trying to get the attention of a television producer. Afterward, they go undercover as rental car employees to intercept a large narcotics delivery from Toledo, and then try to identify and apprehend a rape suspect before he's able to escape on a flight.

programme.title: Leave It to Beaver
programme.desc: While cleaning, June runs across an old family scrapbook and gathers the family together to reminisce about the past six years. The Cleavers recall scenes from previous episodes including: 'Beaver Gets 'Spelled,'' 'New Neighbors,' 'My Brother's Girl,' 'The Shave,' 'Beaver Runs Away,' 'Larry Hides Out,' 'Teacher Comes to Dinner,' and 'Wally's Election.'

programme.title: Leave It to Beaver
programme.desc: Beaver and Wally send away for an alligator and they secretly keep it in the bathroom. When the alligator falls ill, the boys get some advice from Captain Jack, an owner of an alligator farm. However, keeping him a secret is going to be hard; the alligator is growing and they need a new place to keep him without June and Ward finding out.

programme.title: Perry Mason
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Double-entry Mind
programme.desc: Timid bookkeeper Clem Sandover is irate when his longterm embezzlement scheme is discovered by a fellow employee. When that co-worker turns up dead, however, it's Sandover's wife who's charged with the crime.

programme.title: Matlock
programme.desc: Out on parole for a past murder rap, Les Matthews is accosted by three men and one ends up dead in the ensuing struggle. Matlock takes the case, hoping to prove self-defense.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-O
programme.desc: Singer Eadie Jordan plans to make a comeback at a concert, but she is struggling with an addiction to heroin. McGarrett and Five-O learn that arsenic-laced heroin is being sold in the Oahu area.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Grandpa's sister in law is being forced out of their home by a government project.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: When hired gunslinger Joe Bascome balks at his obligation to kill Matt Dillon, his employers, the Douglas brothers, are not pleased.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Wanting to prove his independence and break out of the shadows of his Pa and older brothers, Little Joe sets out to win a lucrative timber contract for the Ponderosa.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas and Mark meet Mark Twain and find out that he hides a sad secret.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas tries to stop embittered John Holliver from venting his wrath on the people who expelled him from town years before.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: At the end of a long journey, lives were lost. Some made it with their dreams intact. Flint tries to help one of the passengers and almost bites off too much. Politics are involved as well as unsolicited trips to the Far East.

programme.title: Emergency!
programme.desc: The paramedics complain when a rule forbidding squads to cross each other's territories causes them to come late to an accident scene. An elderly woman is treated at the hospital. While transporting a non-vital patient, the paramedics respond to an auto accident. A prisoner breaks out of jail and gets trapped on a ledge.

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: A South Korean woman misinterprets Klinger's motives when he tries to help her daughter financially. Meanwhile, Hawkeye wrestles with his conscience over a promise made to a dying soldier, Eddie Hastings.

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: Charles returns to the 4077th after a trip to Tokyo with an uncharacteristic hangover and the uneasy feeling of a romantic entanglement. Meanwhile, the hospital struggles to find a cure for an outbreak of deadly hemorrhagic fever.

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: Hawkeye and B.J. lose their way while rushing urgently needed antibiotics to the 4077th, which is wracked with low-mileage Thanksgiving turkey-induced salmonella. Wandering back to M*A*S*H, the pair are found by a peculiar North Korean soldier.

programme.title: M*A*S*H
programme.desc: Hawkeye and B.J. race against the clock to save a soldier from paralysis. B.J.'s harvesting an aorta from a dead soldier doesn't sit well with the soldier's friend.

programme.title: The Andy Griffith Show
programme.desc: Barney tries to convince everyone of a lack of security at Mayberry Bank, and is furious that no one listens to him. Taking matters into his own hands, he ends up stuck in the bank vault.

programme.title: The Andy Griffith Show
programme.desc: Opie must learn to defend himself against a bully.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra gets upset when Raymond chooses his mother's cooking over hers.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Raymond takes over the checkbook to prove to Debra how "easy it can be" to balance it.

programme.title: Hogan's Heroes
programme.desc: Hogan's plan to blow up a rocket fuel factory boomerangs back at him.

programme.title: Hogan's Heroes
programme.desc: Hogan and his men volunteer to paint the headquarters of the Luftwaffe in order to steal an important map.

programme.title: Carol Burnett and Friends
programme.desc: In The Family, Mama remembers her sister life. Then, in Peace Treaty, Japan and Russia try to sign a peace treaty but can't agree on anything.

programme.title: Perry Mason
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Calendar Girl
programme.desc: A building contractor is charged with the murder of a wealthy political Mr. fix-it.

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: Boxing robot "Battling Maxo" breaks down before a match, forcing its manager to take its place in the ring.

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Presents
programme.desc: A gambling addict cannot resist the lure of $200,000.

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Presents
programme.desc: Albert Pelham is slowly being replaced at home and at work by a double.

programme.title: Mannix
programme.desc: A politically ambitions publisher hires Mannix to find evidence that his wife is cheating. But when Mannix has no trouble finding this evidence, he begins to question the reasons he was hired.

programme.title: Cannon
programme.desc: Cannon gets hired to be a bodyguard for a courier of securities.

programme.title: Barnaby Jones
programme.desc: A rapist threatens to get more violent with Betty's friend if she tells the police.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: A young crop-dusting pilot, Steve Elliott, makes a crash landing near the Shady Rest—and an equally hard impact on Kate Bradley's daughters.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Steve Elliott is about to lose his crop-dusting plane, unless he can acquire the money needed for an overdue payment.

programme.title: The Beverly Hillbillies
programme.desc: Rock 'n' roll idol Johnny Poke visits the Clampetts while in town to play the Hollywood Bowl. Granny's not too happy about it; she's worried Jethro will pick up his bad habits. Granny loses her temper and thinks she turned Jethro into a puppy when she says he needs to be taught a lesson.

programme.title: The Beverly Hillbillies
programme.desc: Granny flies widow Emma Poke out to Beverly Hills to match-make with Jed. She figures she can trick Jed into marriage, though Jed finds out what is going on. However, Jed doesn’t want to marry her, and it turns out that Emma doesn’t want to marry him.

programme.title: Popeye and Pals
programme.sub-title: Puppet Love, Dizzy Divers, A Dream Walking
programme.desc: "Popeye wants to propose Olive, but he doesn't have the courage to express his feelings. , Bluto attempts to get to sunken treasure before Popeye can., Popeye and Bluto are awaken from their sleep by the sound of Olive Oyl sleepwalking."

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.sub-title: Ah Sweet Mouse-story Of Life, That's My Mommy, Cat's Me-ouch, Advance And Be Mechanized
programme.desc: "In this episode, involving both the abstract and transportation, both Tom and Jerry make use of their thoughts to gain the upper hand against one another., A baby duck gets confused and thinks Tom is its mother but Jerry tries to convince it otherwise as the cat tries to make a meal of the duckling., Jerry gets a dog to beat Tom up and he ends up in the hospital with the dog clinging to him by the teeth., Tom is a space security guard and he uses his cat robot to chase Jerry's mouse robot as it attempts to sneak some cheese out of the Mining Facility."

programme.title: The Woody Woodpecker Show
programme.sub-title: Fair Weather Fiends, Swing Your Partner, Crazy House, Puny Express, The Ostrich Egg And I, Sliphorn King Of Polaroo, Sleep Happy
programme.desc: "A storm strands Woody and Wolfie on a deserted island, and they battle each other to find food., Homer drags his horse out of bed to drive his buggy to the barn dance. In anger, Hank breaks up the dance and forces Homer to pull the buggy home., Andy and his father take shelter from a storm in a fun house., Cowboy Woody the Pony Express rider must contend with Buzz the bandits attempts to steal his mail., Sam brings an ostrich egg home, which hatches into an ostrich that devours everything in sight. Maggie orders Sam to get rid of it, but it returns with a family of its own in tow., A trombone playing, merchant-marine sailor is shipwrecked in the far north, and the animals like his playing so much that he is named Sliphorn King of Polaroo., Woody takes advantage of a vacancy in Wally Walrus' house and keeps him up all night with his unusualy snoring."

programme.title: Bugs Bunny and Friends
programme.sub-title: Hare We Go, A Hick A Slick And A Chick, Porky Pig's Feat, Falling Hare, A Broken Leghorn, Buckaroo Bugs
programme.desc: "Bugs accompanies Christopher Columbus to search for America. , Elmo and Blackie compete for Daisy Lou’s affection., When Daffy and Porky are unable to pay their hotel bill because Daffy lost all their money gambling, the manager locks them in their room until they do. , A gremlin hijacks a WWII bomber and Bugs must stop him before the gremlin does some serious damage. , Foghorn tries to do a good deed by helping childless old Prissy Hen to lay an egg by planting one when she's not looking. Trouble arrises when the hatchling wants to take over Foghorn's job. , The masked marauder strikes again! A local dopey-hero is hired to catch the villain. Bugs gives the hero a hard time until he realizes that the masked marauder is Bugs! "

programme.title: The Wild Wild West
programme.sub-title: The Night Of The Big Blast
programme.desc: A mad scientist has created a way to turn people into walking mind-controlled explosives... and Jim West is her next victim.

programme.title: Wagon Train
programme.desc: Planning to sail to Boston, the Major, Hawks and Charlie are instead shanghaied to New Orleans where they meet a Captain who has different ideas on raising his child and running a ship.

programme.title: The Big Valley
programme.desc: Jarrod’s client, Jeff Bowden, was convicted of the murder of a priest. Jarrod is convinced of the man’s innocence and sure he can win on appeal. When Bowden escapes during his transfer to prison, Jarrod tries to intervene before he or anyone else gets killed.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Hootie Kyle is a poor but honest farmer whose credit has run out. Matt Dillon and Festus lend him some money, only to be swindled out of it in a poker game. Later, Hootie gets circumstantially framed for the murder of the card shark who swindled him.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Sgt. Samuel Bellis is accused of desertion, murder and selling guns to the Indians. Bellis insists that he's innocent, and Candy believes him, but before he can clear Bellis' name, he must elude the Army patrol hot on the fugitive sergeant's heels.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas becomes the target of a vengeful mountaineer.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark finds himself the unwilling companion of gunman Carl Avery.

programme.title: Rawhide
programme.desc: Stricken with a mysterious illness, the drovers stagger into a deserted town where they are met by a pretty yet strange woman.

programme.title: Have Gun, Will Travel
programme.desc: A British woman, Diana Coulter, hires Paladin to guide her to her brother's ranch in Shiprock, Arizona, where the Comanches are on the warpath.

programme.title: Wanted Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh allows a newspaper reporter from the east to follow him on a manhunt for a story.

programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.sub-title: Three Little Pirates, Hugs And Mugs, Hold That Lion, Punchy Cowpunchers, Who Done It, Outer Space Jitters
programme.desc: "The Stooges are castaways from a garbage scow who land on Dead Man's Island where everyone is living in olden times. To escape from the governor, they disguise Curly as a Maharaja and win permission to journey to their own country to fetch presents. The governor is fooled, but the boys run into more trouble in the den of Black Louie the pirate where Curly is forced into a knife-throwing contest with Larry as the target. Things look bad until a mis-thrown knife cuts the rope that holds the chandelier and it crashes down on Black Louie's men. With the pirates defeated, Moe decides to take over as ruler of the island. , The Stooges run a furniture store and come into possession of a stolen pearl necklace. Three crooked dames convince the boys that the necklace is theirs, and when the real thieves arrive, the Stooges fight to defend the girl's property. The Stooges defeat the bad guys and the girls decide to go honest and return the necklace to its rightful owner. , The Stooges accompany professor Jones on an expedition to Venus, where they discover that the Venusians are planning to conquer the earth with an army of zombies. When the boys learn that they're going to be turned into zombies, they escape. The scene changes to the Stooges apartment where we learn they are just telling a bedtime story to their kids (also played by the Stooges) while they wait for the baby sitter to arrive. When the baby sitter shows up, she looks like one of the zombies and the boys exit in a hurry. , The Stooges are gypped out of their inheritance by Icabob Slipp, a crooked lawyer. The boys follow Slipp onto a passenger train and corner him, but not before they accidentally let a lion loose on the train. , Set in the old west, the Stooges are three soldiers assigned to go undercover and spy on an outlaw gang that's terrorizing a nearby town. The bad guys have the Arizona Kid locked up, so the boys set about rescuing him with the help of beautiful Nell, his girl. They free the kid, and he rides to summon help. The Stooges, with the help of Nell, manage to subdue the bad guys before the kid arrives with the cavalry. , The Stooges are private detectives looking for a missing millionaire. They wander around the millionaire's spooky mansion confronting various crooks and a dangerous dame. The Stooges vanquish the crooks (Shemp uses his "trusty shovel") and find the missing man. "

programme.title: Svengoolie
programme.desc: "Wolf Frankenstein, son of Henry Frankenstein, returns with his wife, to his fathers estate to claim his inheritance. When he arrives with his family he recieves a hostile reception from locals. While exploring his fathers laboratory he comes across crooked blacksmith - Ygor, who asks him to revive his father's creation - the MONSTER who is lying in a coma. Wolf tries to revive the monster and believes he fails but then some of the locals are found murdered soon after who just happened to be part of the jury that sent Ygor to the gallows. The villagers immediately connect the killings to Frankenstein and send the inspector to investigate. He discovers the monster is alive and is being used as tool by Ygor. Wolf then in fit of madness shoots Ygor. The then enraged monster losing his only friend kidnaps Wolf's son. In the end Wolf tracks the monster to the lab where he swings down on a chain knocking the monster into a sulpher pit and thus his demise."

programme.title: Batman
programme.desc: Using her Voice-Eraser, Catwoman plans to steal the voices of British rock singers staying at the Wayne Manor.

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: Kirk and the Enterprise must combat parasitic aliens.

programme.title: Adventures of Superman
programme.desc: Jimmy Olsen visits his aunt and discovers a group of smugglers on her island home.

programme.title: Adventures of Superman
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Talkative Dummy
programme.desc: Armored cars are robbed and then disappear. A ventriloquist's dummy is used to transmit the armored cars' routes.

programme.title: Lost in Space
programme.desc: "A person known as ' the thief from outer space' appears in a puff of smoke, will agrees to help him rescue a princess who was lost more than 200 years ago by evil vizier."

programme.title: Land of the Giants
programme.desc: The Spindrift party encounter an amnesiac Earthling who has been stranded on the planet for some time. However, it soon becomes clear that the newcomer isn't what he claims.

programme.title: The Time Tunnel
programme.desc: The travelers materialize in 1895 on Devil's Island, where they try to help French captain Alfred Dreyfus escape.

programme.title: The Invaders
programme.desc: David's personal life threatens his mission when aliens resort to foul play to recover a computer tape.
